intro: Cyrtandra stonei, commonly known as the Hawaiian rock orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its tubular flowers and fleshy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. Cyrtandra stonei is known for its striking purple and yellow floral colors, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
